Articles.Content: How can I find the active vessel? FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel does not work for me
I can use FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel just fine. Are you trying to use that in the flight scene?

if you want your stuff to be applied on every loaded vessel, this vessel might be the way to go though. But yeah, if you are in the editor, you aren'T looking for a vessel, you are looking for a ShipConstruct. EditorLogic.fetch.ship should return the current vessel being built.
I am trying to find the active vessel in flight
In the flight scene FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel would be the correct one.
It keeps saying it it is null
When are you using it ? It's null if you call it too soon in some of the loading function.
At the beginning of Update(), I could move it to Start() though

That's because the vessel is still packed when you are trying to access it.

try 

if (!FlightGlobals.ActiveVessel.packed) //or .loaded, not sure.
{
   //stuff
}

Edited January 6, 2014 by stupid_chris
You could leave it in Update(), but just don't do anything until it gets non-null. Would that help?
